unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: CloudFront functions are written in JavaScript, enabling the execution of scripts.
A CloudFront function can be set to trigger on specific events, establishing persistence.
CloudFront functions can modify requests and responses, which can be used to evade detection tools.
The JavaScript code within CloudFront functions can be obfuscated to hide malicious intent.
CloudFront functions can communicate using web protocols, facilitating command and control.
Functions can be used to remove or alter log files, helping in defense evasion.
CloudFront functions manipulate the flow of requests, which can be seen as hijacking the execution flow within the cloud infrastructure.
CloudFront functions can be designed to use fallback channels for command and control if the primary method is disrupted.
Improperly configured or malicious CloudFront functions can cause application exhaustion, leading to denial-of-service attacks.

researchLinks.description: How Attackers Can Misuse AWS CloudFront Access to Make It ‘Rain’ Cookies

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateFunction to add a new function that can be use to exfiltrate date.
